definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The amount of electrolyte leakage was highly related to the treating time and concentration of toxin.
sentences.chinese: 且電解質外滲的程度與毒素濃度和處理時間呈正比。

sentences.english: Specifically, luminosity is proportional to radius squared.
sentences.chinese: 具體來說，光度與半徑的平方呈正比。

sentences.english: The monitoring system samples stack gas at a rate proportional to the stack gas volumetric flow rate.
sentences.chinese: 煙道氣樣品的監控系統速率成正比的煙氣體積流量。

sentences.english: It was found that the decrease of absorbance of guest-host cell is almost proportional to the exposure time and light intensity.
sentences.chinese: 發現賓主盒吸光度的減少幾乎正比於暴光時間和強度。

sentences.english: It′s shown that the efficiency of catalyzed degradation is directly proportional to the time of bubbling oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 實驗表明催化氧化降解效率與鼓氧時間成正比。

sentences.english: For men, relationship happiness was directly proportional to the length of a relationship.
sentences.chinese: 對男性來說，交往愉悅程度直接與交往的長短成正比。

sentences.english: And the velocity of slow compressional-wave(P-wave) is in direct proportion to the porosity and the density of fluid.
sentences.chinese: 而慢縱波的速度則和孔隙度和流體的密度成正比。

sentences.english: The actual stress is not proportional to the bending moment .
sentences.chinese: 實際上應力與彎矩不成正比。

sentences.english: Woman's softheartedness, with man's hypocrisy, proportional to.
sentences.chinese: 女人的心慈手軟，與男人的口是心非，成正比。

sentences.english: The price is proportional to the size of isomorphous.
sentences.chinese: 價格同晶片大小成正比。

sentences.english: The X100 provides a linear output proportional to displacement.
sentences.chinese: X100更爲提供了一個線性輸出位移成正比。

sentences.english: People in the rural areas know more than we care to admit.
sentences.chinese: 鄉區人民所知的和我們知道的不成正比。

sentences.english: It was found that the occurrence of epilepsy was not in close relation with the severity of brain hypoxia.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明癲癇的有無與腦缺氧的嚴重程度並不成正比。

sentences.english: Notice that the acceleration, the centripetal acceleration is linear in r.
sentences.chinese: 在此注意，向心加速度與r是成正比的。

sentences.english: And the efficiency with which they do so is directly proportional to the value the investment contributes to the overall project portfolio.
sentences.chinese: 並且他們的效率同對整個項目的貢獻成正比。

sentences.english: Density of fire increases proportionably to the curiousness of the target.
sentences.chinese: 火力的密度與轟擊目標的謹慎度成正比。

definition: to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
equal to/having the same social class or status
